label: Customer Journey Mapping

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers struggle to understand why customers abandon carts at different stages of the journey, leading to $18B annual lost revenue from incomplete purchases. (Source: Salesforce Commerce Cloud Report)

QSR customers have short, impulse-driven journeys with high mobile usage, making friction points hard to identify without real-time data.
Hospitality booking journeys include multiple touchpoints from search to check-in, with service recovery opportunities missed in static maps.

label: Omnichannel Orchestration

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers cannot track customer journeys that start on mobile apps and complete in stores, leading to inaccurate measurement of marketing ROI and suboptimal channel investments. (Source: Adobe Experience Cloud Report)
Grocery customers research products online but purchase in-store, with no continuity between digital research and physical shopping experiences.
Travel bookings often start on mobile devices but complete on desktops, with frequent abandonment when customers switch channels mid-process.
QSR customers expect seamless transitions between mobile ordering, drive-thru, and in-store pickup without re-entering information.
Hotel bookings initiated on mobile apps require customers to re-enter details when completing on desktop, increasing abandonment rates.

agenticApproach.description: Seamless handoffs between channels with instant cart sync, unified messaging, and consistent personalization everywhere

Significant reduction in channel-switch abandonment

quickWins: Deploy cart sync between web and mobile app

Enable context handoff for top 3 customer journeys
